tabs.title: Scenario
tabs.content:
**Stratos Retail** is a global retail company headquartered in Seattle with regional offices in Toronto, London, and Sydney. The company operates two Active Directory forests: prod.stratos.com for production workloads and dev.stratos.com for development teams. There is no trust relationship between the forests.

**Current Environment:**
The production forest (prod.stratos.com) handles authentication for all internal users and business applications. The development forest is isolated and used exclusively by the R&D team working on experimental projects. Each regional office maintains at least one domain controller for prod.stratos.com, while all dev.stratos.com domain controllers are located at headquarters.

Stratos Retail's primary customer-facing application, OrderTracker, runs in their Seattle datacenter on Hyper-V virtual machines. The application consists of an ASP.NET web tier hosted on IIS and a Microsoft SQL Server 2019 backend. A separate Hyper-V environment is used for testing OrderTracker updates before production deployment.

The company has an Enterprise Agreement with Microsoft that includes Software Assurance benefits. OrderTracker experiences highly variable traffic patternsâ€”peak shopping seasons cause performance complaints, while off-peak periods leave resources significantly underutilized.

**Migration Plans:**
Stratos Retail is planning a multi-year cloud migration to Azure. The first phase includes establishing hybrid identity to support a Microsoft 365 rollout, followed by migrating OrderTracker to Azure. Development operations will remain entirely on-premises.

tabs.title: Technical Requirements
tabs.content:
**Technical Requirements:**
- Web content updates must be deployable from a centralized location
- New web app instances should require minimal manual configuration
- Leverage existing on-premises licenses where possible to minimize costs
- Users must authenticate using their prod.stratos.com UPN
- Azure deployments must maintain availability during regional failures
- Use Azure App Service Standard tier when feasible
- IT Operations must receive email notifications for directory sync issues
- Azure-hosted VMs must authenticate to AD even if connectivity to on-premises fails
- Azure AD synchronization must continue during on-premises network outages

tabs.title: Database Requirements
tabs.content:
**Database Requirements:**
- Production database metrics must be available for performance analysis
- Database migration must minimize customer-facing downtime
- Backups must be retained for 7 years for regulatory compliance

tabs.title: Security Requirements
tabs.content:
**Security Requirements:**
- All company data must be inaccessible to external parties
- On-premises users must authenticate even during internet outages
- Azure portal access requires MFA for administrators
- OrderTracker test environments must not be publicly accessible
- An Azure Storage account must be provisioned for database migration staging
